sentences.en: A crab nipped my toe while I was paddling.
sentences.cn: 我水时脚趾让螃蟹给夹了.

sentences.en: A crab nipped my toe while I was swimming.
sentences.cn: 我游泳时,一只螃蟹钳住了我的脚指头.
一只螃蟹箝住了我的脚趾头.

sentences.en: All the shops on the seafront had crab for sale.
sentences.cn: 海滨地区的全部商店都出售蟹.

sentences.en: Although it is tasty, crab is very filling.
sentences.cn: 螃蟹虽然好吃，却容易让人感到饱足。

sentences.en: The claws of a crab are used for grasping things, especially food.
sentences.cn: 螃蟹用钳抓东西, 特别是食物.

sentences.en: The fiddler crab is a living clock.
sentences.cn: 招潮水蟹是一只活闹钟.

sentences.en: The skin on my face felt as hard as a crab's back.
sentences.cn: 我脸上的皮仿佛僵硬了,就象螃蟹的壳似的.

sentences.en: They were spread like crab grass at that time.
sentences.cn: 在那时,他们就象野草一样,遍地都是.

sentences.en: Thousands of herring and crab are washed up on the beaches during every storm.
sentences.cn: 每次暴风雨过后海滩上都会留下数不尽的鲱鱼和螃蟹。

sentences.en: Well, the crab salad's always a big hit.
sentences.cn: 嗯, 蟹肉沙拉一向是广受欢迎的.

words.tran_cn: 暴躁的；难懂的；晦涩的；潦草的
螃蟹；蟹肉；脾气乖戾的人；起重机

phrases.tran_cn: 失一桨：用一桨划水，用以恢复划水或划船时失去一桨
蟹肉；灌装冻蟹肉，冻蟹肉
皇帝蟹；鳕场蟹；勘察加拟石蟹；鲎

trans.tran_en: a sea animal with a hard shell, five legs on each side, and two large  claws
